Ingredient.Name: Hondeydew Melon
Ingredient.Notes: Biggest, ripest on you can find.

Method.Step: Using a blender, puree the melon. The puree might be quite foamy, but it's okay, the foam will go away during the freezing process -in fact, the foam probably helps keep the frozen slush from becoming too solid.
Add the 7-UP, rum, and the Midori. Stir well and place in the freezer.

About every 2 hours or so, run a whisk or large fork through the mixture to whip air into it, distribute the flavors and alcohol. This is kind of like making a freezer sorbet. In about 8 hours the slush will be ready to serve.
